alert.note: Alert for Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley; Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 11 at 5:00AM PDT until August 12 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Very Low RH and Gusty Winds in FWZs 284...285...And 624 Thursday and Friday afternoons and evenings... .Gusty south to southwest winds combined with very low RH will lead to critical fire weather conditions Thursday afternoon and evening and, likely, again Friday afternoon and evening across portions of south central Oregon and northeastern California. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In Northern CA, the northeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 284 including Lava Beds and Tule Lake as well as northern and eastern portions of Fire Weather Zone 285 including the Modoc Plateau, areas near and east of Alturas, and the Warner Mountains. In South Central OR, the southeastern portion of Fire Weather Zone 624 including much of Winter Rim, Bonanza, Bly, Lakeview, and Valley Falls. * Wind: South to southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts 25 to 35 mph. * Humidity: 7 to 15 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD

area.areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley; Siskiyou County from the Cascade Mountains East and South to Mt Shasta
